text:
="preserve">Christian Manen (3 July 1934 – 11 September 2020) was a French composer and music teacher. In 1961 he won the Premier Grand Prix de Rome with the cantata "La Loreley". He worked at the Villa Medici in Rome until 1965. That same year, he began working at Conservatoire de Paris.
Manen died on 11 September 2020 at the age of 86.
